intro: Sarothrostachys daphniphylla, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with a distinctive silvery-white underside. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. Its woody structure and adaptability to various soil types make it a popular ornamental species. However, it is important to note that it may have invasive tendencies in certain regions.
